intro: Roettlera primulacea, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Its flowers, which range from yellow to orange, bloom in late summer and early autumn. Roettlera primulacea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
